Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
A nest of Hopperhounds, vicious creatures that plague post-collapse Star Union worlds.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.
A nest of Quartzite, silicon lifeforms with different properties based on their rock formation.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.
A nest of Mega Beetles, creatures with strong pincers, Biochemical attacks and explosive death rattles.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.
Structure description. Explosive death rattle means that they explode when killed.
Hideout of freemen and ex-mercenaries, surviving by stealing and selling tech and gear.[br/]If neglected, the pirates will raid nearby colonies and armies.
The gentle Octowhale and the boat-eating Chelus live in these depths, aiding one another.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.
Empire submarines guard these waters, attacking any intruders they detect on their radars.[br/]If neglected, the submarines will attack nearby colonies and armies.
Once locked in zoos by the Star Union, their collection now nests here after the Collapse.[br/]If neglected, the creatures will attack nearby colonies and armies.
A mountain range is present within the sector.
A mountain range is present within the sector. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Production [production/] and Energy [energy/] sectors on Mountains gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long biome description with player tips and economy info.
There is a forested area present in this sector. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Production [production/] and Food [supply/] sectors on Forest gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long biome description with player tips and economy info.
Old remains of the Star Union are still present in this sector. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Research [research/] and Energy [energy/] sectors on Ruins gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long biome description with player tips and economy info.
There is a recently urbanized area present in this sector.[br/][br/]Units in friendly urban sectors heal an additional {UrbanHealthRegenAmount} between strategic turns.

Preserved technology and infrastructure from before the Cataclysm bears witness to the lost grandeur of the Star Union.[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Research [research/], Energy [energy/], Food [food/] and Production [production/] sectors on Imperial gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]

These plains are highly fertile and have a rich population of microscopic life. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Research [research/] and Food [supply/] sectors on Fertile Plains gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long biome description with player tips and economy info.
Coastal sectors are sectors of Ocean that are bordered by a landmass. Due to their proximity to land, Coastal sectors are more easily exploited.

Coastal sectors are sectors of Ocean that are bordered by a landmass. Due to their proximity to land, Coastal sectors are more easily exploited. Coast sectors yield Energy [energy/], Food [supply/] and Knowledge [research/]. [br/][br/]Colony Upgrades:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][titleBrown]{XML_COLONYUPGRADES_STRATEGIC@LEVEL_UP@NAME_WATER}[/titleBrown][/bullet][br/][grey]Required Research: {XML_ECONOMY_TECHGROUPS@TECH_TREE@SKILLGROUP_3_NAME}[/grey][/bulletlist][br/][bulletlist][bullet][titleBrown]{XML_COLONYUPGRADES_STRATEGIC@LEVEL_UP@NAME_WATER_II}[/titleBrown][/bullet][br/][grey]Required Research: {XML_ECONOMY_TECHGROUPS@TECH_TREE@SKILLGROUP_5_NAME}[/grey][/bulletlist]
Long biome description with player tips and economy info.
The arcadian climate is an unspoiled, harmonious wilderness predominantly consisting of grasslands.

The arcadian climate is an unspoiled, harmonious wilderness predominantly consisting of grasslands. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Food [supply/] and Energy [energy/] sectors on Arcadian gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long clime description with player tips and economy info.
The arctic climate is a snow covered landscape with harsh conditions.

The arctic climate is a snow covered landscape with harsh conditions.[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Research [research/] and Production [production/] sectors on Arctic gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long clime description with player tips and economy info.
The arid climate is defined by a dry, unforgiving heat and a general lack of water.

The arid climate is defined by a dry, unforgiving heat and a general lack of water. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Energy [energy/] and Production [production/] sectors on Arid gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long clime description with player tips and economy info.
The fungal climate is host to wild growth resulting in an extremely biodiverse area.

The fungal climate is host to wild growth resulting in an extremely biodiverse area. [br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]All Research [research/] and Food [supply/] sectors on Fungal gain +1 level.[/bullet][/bulletlist]
Long clime description with player tips and economy info.
Volcanic sectors are hostile wastelands with harsh living conditions.

Volcanic sectors are hostile wastelands with harsh living conditions.[br/][br/][negative]Colonies in this sector get [abilityred]-8[/abilityred][anger/].[/negative][br/][br/]Possible research:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][titlebrown]{XML_ECONOMY_TECHGROUPS@TECH_TREE@SKILLGROUP_6_NAME}[/titlebrown][/bullet][br/][indent]Colonies ignore all economic penalties from Volcanic terrain.[/indent][/bulletlist]
Long sector description with player tips and economy info.
Ocean sectors are great regions signified by a vast amount of water and endless depths.

Ocean sectors are great regions signified by a vast amount of water and endless depths. Ocean sectors normally do not provide any economic bonuses and cannot be annexed to a colony, except if a Coast is present.
Long sector description with player tips and economy info.
Lava sectors are large regions of never cooling, constantly hot lava.
Lava sectors are large regions of never cooling, constantly hot lava. Lava sectors do not provide any economic bonusses and cannot be annexed to a colony.
Void sectors are parts of the planet that have disappeared into the Void dimension.
Void sectors are parts of the planet that have disappeared into the Void dimension. Void sectors do not provide any economic bonuses and cannot be annexed to a colony.

A chasm filled with lava runs through this sector. [br/][br/]Possible Research:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][titlebrown]{XML_ECONOMY_TECHGROUPS@TECH_TREE@SKILLGROUP_6_NAME}[/titlebrown][/bullet][br/][indent]Your colony gains {energy} Energy for each sector with a Lava chasm within its domain.[/indent][/bulletlist]
Long sector description with player tips and economy info.

A river runs through this sector. [br/][br/]Possible Research:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][titlebrown]{XML_ECONOMY_TECHGROUPS@TECH_TREE@SKILLGROUP_2_5_NAME}[/titlebrown][/bullet][br/][indent]Your colony gains {food} Food for each sector with a River within its domain.[/indent][/bulletlist]
Long sector description with player tips and economy info.
This sector is a potential location to found a new colony. Founding a new colony requires a Colonizer unit.
This sector is uninhabitable. You cannot build a colony or a forward base here, nor can you annex this sector to a colony.
This sector cannot be prospected to gain extra resources.
Fertile meadows are perfect for food production. [br/]Grants {MeadowsSupply} [supply/]Food to the colony it is linked to.

Hidden from the naked eye, these 'meadows' are artificially modified to be unnaturally fertile. Food production for fresh Star Union colonies would often begin here as larger supply facilities were still being constructed.

These fertile meadows seem natural but are artificially made as incredibly fertile as they are via manners invisible to the naked eye, maintained by terratech in the Union's prime these fields are now left to grow unchecked.
This sector features a River Delta. [br/]Grants {DeltaSupply} [supply/]Food to the colony it is linked to.

River Deltas had been vital to the development of civilization, but with the advancement of civilization, their importance has been marginalized. They are still fertile lands perfect for agriculture, and smaller colonies often made use of them.
Geothermal Rifts contain chasms of boiling magma, rife with energy to be exploited. [br/]Grants {GeothermalEnergy} [energy/]Energy to the colony it is linked to.

Geothermal energy is ever-present in habitable planets. Sometimes this violent energy erupts onto the surface, creating Geothermal Rifts. Ideal resources of natural energy, these Rifts are often used to generate the power necessary for the function of nearby Star Union colonies.

Highrise districts housed many of the Star Union's citizenry in their tall residential blocks. [br/]Grants +{slot} [Foodslot/], +{slot} [productionslot/], +{slot} [energyslot/] and +{slot} [researchslot/] to the colony it is linked to.
The residential blocks of the Star Union's Highrise districts housed thousands of citizens each. It was in these blocks that the Star Union's middle class lived, under the watchful eye of CORE.
Star Union Transit Hubs are vital to any colony's logistics efforts. This sector contains an unusually high amount of retrievable supplies and logistical structures.

Transit Hubs are common on Star Union worlds, functioning as centers of on-world logistics. From these sectors, the allocation and transport of resources is coordinated, and they function as storage centers for shipments before they are sent out.

Industrial Refineries were where a large part of the automated manufacturing for the Star Union took place. This district has strong production capabilities. Additionally, this sector contains a refinery which has been claimed by the Spacers, who use it to refine traditional fuels to supply their raids. [br/]Grants {RefineryIncome} [production/] to the colony it is linked to.

Traditional fuels had always retained a degree of use in heavy machinery in the Star Union. After the Cataclysm the Spacers' became the main consumers of these fuels, using them to supply their vehicles as they fought for resources on their isolated worlds.
This sector was once a thriving Star Union colony district, before being reclaimed by the sea.[br/]Grants {SunkenDistrictResearch} [research/] to the colony it is linked to.

The Star Union districts sprawl across its worlds. In order to make efficient use of space, certain sectors were laid dry to allow for urbanization. Now that the land is no longer maintained, these districts are once more at the mercy of the sea, the riches the district once contained washed away with the tide.
This sector contains a reef, a good source of food and a prime location for wildlife to breed and make their nests. [br/]Grants {ReefFoodIncome} [supply/] to the colony it is linked to.

Reefs are still rare, even on life-bearing worlds featuring oceans. Wherever they can be found, however, they are hotbeds for wildlife, making them prime sources of food for nearby Star Union colonies.
This sector contains a tectonic rift through which geothermal energy from the planet's core is leaking into the ocean.[br/] Grants {RiftIncome} [energy/] to the colony it is linked to.

Underwater rifts are formed on the edges of tectonic plates and are signified by magmatic activity. The resulting heat leaking from these rifts comes directly from the planet's core and is nearly endless, making them a great source for harvesting geothermal energy.

Beneath these fields lie endless tunnels where Quartzite dig up the minerals they use as sustenance and bring them to the surface. These fields were always a prime target for Star Union mining operations.

A useful byproduct to the Quartzite lifecycle is the formation of Quartzite crystals, grown onto the body of Quartzite and filled with energy absorbed from the minerals they consume. These crystals are secreted from the body and litter their territories to serve as food sources in the future. They can be found in vast underground tunnel networks in Quartzite regions, sometimes fusing together and growing into a crystal cluster that breaches the surface.

A Communications District contains massive transmission towers that were used to broadcast propaganda and all other communications on the planet. It also intercepted all communication for processing by CORE. Information of all aspects of the Star Union was stored here and could be retrieved.[br/] Grants {CommunicationKnowledge} [research/] to the colony it is linked to.
Transmission towers were essential to the function of the civilian layer of the Nexus. All transmissions through the ether would pass through these towers, under CORE's watchful eye.

This district was once the main hub for training the Star Union's Vanguard. Since the Cataclysm, they have only served to reinforce the Paragon's military pride. [br/] Grants {TrainingIncome} [research/] to the colony it is linked to.

During the height of the Star Union, these training districts were present on most of its worlds, raising fresh soldiers for the Vanguard. Now the training facilities within these districts function as little more than trophies for Paragon lords, but an ambitious leader might make good use of these facilities.
Multiple artifacts can be found in this sector, incentivizing the researching community.[br/]Grants {DigSiteResearch} to the colony it is linked to.

During the Star Union's rule, artifacts bearing Celestian markings were unearthed all over their territory. Some archeologists theorized that these might be proof that this 'Celestian' civilization is older than the Star Union itself, but these theories were quickly silenced.

Factory Complexes such as these are commonly found throughout the remains of the Star Union. They produced much of the Union's goods, both for the military and for civilians.[br/]Grants {FactoryComplexProduction} [production/] to the colony it is linked to.

Factory Complexes were not directly owned by the many megacorporations of the Star Union. Instead, these complexes were established by local governors for use by smaller corporations, though many of these eventually became merely extentions of a megacorporation's interests.
